Bioshock Infinite is the last of the Bioshock series thus far, and it not only stands out as a stand alone game, but it brings all three games together into one to give a more enhanced understanding of what you've experienced from the original Bioshock up until Infinite.  Through-out the game you play Booker Dewitt who is tasked in finding Elizabeth in the city in the clouds, Columbia, and bringing her back.  The game constantly fantasizes with the idea of utopia, all while glamorizing gruesome violence and horrendous philosophies of racial superiority.  The storyline is clever, difficult at times to follow, but truly offers some very deep plot points that offers a great way to tell a story.  While I don't think I can ruin the story by saying too much as the story can be confusing if you don't play the game directly through, it would definitely give away some of the aha moments that the game does have from time to time, including a great twist at the end.

I did play both Burial at Sea DLCs which has you return from Columbia back into Rapture under the ocean, and both those DLCs continued the storyline quite well and offered to fill certain plot holes that may still have been questionable or confusing.  Both were fun.  The first one has you again as Booker Dewitt, while the second one has you playing as Elizabeth.

The action of the game is great.  With the right hand you carry a weapon, two at a time maximum.  The range of weapons go from RPG, to hand cannon, to pistol, and more.  Nothing too out of the ordinary, but each one presents a different way of taking on the battles and the fights, and eventually you'll find the two that you prefer to hold on to for the gameplay style you prefer.  With the left hand, you can use plasmids to pretty much cast spells.  The plasmids you can use range from freezing things, to throwing fire, and electricty, or befriending enemies to fight on your side.  It is rather fun to find a good groove of shooting casting plasmids, and moving around a huge area to fight off the enemies.  You can even use your metal arm to ride the rails and jump from the rails to land on your enemies and more.  The action is fun, quite satisfying, and also not too difficult.  I haven't played the game on 1999 mode, I played it on hard, but it did not stop me from feeling like I was ever held back due to the difficulty.  In the 2nd DLC, the gameplay is slightly different in the sense that Elizabeth takes on a stealth approach to the action.  Sneaking up on people and knocking them out or shooting loud darts to distract enemies are what gets you around enemies.  The stealth gameplay is actually well done where walking on water, glass, or making too much noise will alert the enemy as they come looking for you.

The graphics in this game are gorgeous.  This is not an OLD game, but it is quite dated as far as video games go, but the art style of this game and the vivid colors of Columbia still make for a beautiful game to play.  The details are great with added publicity here and there to push the message of the game such as finding signs that say, "Never trust a slacker."  The game is tough on humanity as the leaders of Bioshock games seek to find their own utopia.  Here in Bioshock Infinite you seek to find and destroy Comstock who is almost seen as God to the world of Columbia.

The music, the sounds, the voice overs, everything is just right on and immerse you into the world of Columbia.  And while the the vivid colors and the sound make it so beautiful, the action glorifies absolute gore.  With your metal arm, you can tear right into people's guts, or faces with blood splattering everywhere.  The action is not dulled down at all as the intensity of the graphics continue but in a dark way.

I have not yet played the Clash in the Clouds DLC yet, and I have not yet unlocked all of the achievements for both the main games and DLCs, but I will gladly try to get 100% on this game.  Playing this game feels like I need to replay the original Bioshock games as I feel like I will better understand the entire overarching storyline that I didn't expect would be connected when I started this last iteration in the series.

If you have not yet taken the time to play this game, you should do yourself a favor and give it a shot.  Again, while it's somewhat old in gaming years, I still feel like it offers a very unique experience that I have not seen in any other game.  Ken Levine is a master of game design and he truly hit this one out of the park.
Best single player game of the decade.
Jogo sensacional, jogatina maravilhosa, enredo rico e personagens que cativam!

An excellent story, presented amazingly, through a world loaded with detail. I enjoyed my playthrough, but if you've played the game's predecessors, you'll find that the storytelling is more rigid this time around; the game's Disneyland-like world is less atmospheric than Rapture; and the gameplay has been dumbed-down and simplified. Combat in particular is much less strategic and dangerous--you now cannot use medkits in combat as they're used on pickup, so death is sometimes unavoidable but also unpunished as you respawn in combat with no loss of progress, so you'll spend most of your time standing in the face of enemies unloading your guns. Be aware that where the previous games were both story- and gameplay-driven, this is primarily and almost wholly story-driven and cinematic.
mindbendingly cool
guess, the best game ive ever played in such a wonderful world
Visually too busy but overall a good game. Overrated but good.
[F] COMFORT ELIZABETH

Здравствуйте дорогие читатели моего отзыва. Я рад, что именно вы предпочли мой отзыв в качестве выбора: «покупать игру или пройти мимо неё?», да, скажу я вам, эта игра не оставит вас равнодушным. У неё отлично получается передать эпоху, характер персонажей, события, неожиданные повороты, множество вопросов на которых множество теорий, догадок и, в особенности, взрывная концовка. Если вы такой же сентиментальный(или нет) как и я, поверьте, эта игра засядет в вашей голове на долгое время. Вы настолько влюбляетесь в персонажей походу игры что они для вас кажутся реальными, вы чувствуете их, вы переживаете моменты вместе с ними и за это я благодарен этой игре, что у них получилась воссоздать это чувство. Мало кому удавалось довезти меня до слез(не сомневайтесь), но эта игра успешна справилась с этой целью. 
Отдельное внимание хочу уделить DLC, это абсолютно отдельная история и она запомнится вам надолго.  
10/10

Отличное продолжение серии. С хорошей графикой, нормальным управлением и балансом. Атмосфера тут своя, не как в первых двух частях. Тут немного о другом.

Нужно проходить все части подряд и обязательно пройти 2 DLC к Bioshock Infinite: Burial at Sea. Тогда все сойдется в один пазл и вы постигните всю историю. Сценаристы проделали отличную работу. Это не просто шутер, это целый путь.

TheEntire story of BioShock game series including Burial at sea, Minerva`s Den made me creep all over. The atmosphere is on the highest level in all games. Also, there are unusual graphics, music, story, the world underwater and at the sky - this is all incredible. As for me, the most exciting story is "Burial at sea: Episode 1 & 2" because it is completely connected with the first BioShock. It was so interesting to play and figure out the origins of Rapture. 

    This is unforgettable gaming experience. You`ll definitely like it if you`re BioShock fan or even if you`re unfamiliar with it.

剧情出彩，场景惊艳，但这个游戏就只有这两个优点了。
1.WIN10不可以开中文输入法，必须切换成全英并且打开大写锁定，才能保证游戏不闪退。
2.射击手感跟没有一样，作为一款FPS已经失败了！
3.场景可互动性低下，跑图，打，跑图，打，就只有这么一种玩法了。
我听说这款游戏被称为是艺术品，给与了很高的期待值，真正玩起来确实场景很美，剧情很棒，但是不好玩。
果然艺术品是不能被我这种凡夫俗子接受的啊，我只能给予一个中等评价。

Gameplay is an improvement for sure, but directly comparing it to the last two Bioshock games, it's a disappointment. Every chapter is always a lot of walking and exposition with at most two minutes of firefights before you move on to the next chapter and do the same old song and dance. Plus the ending was confusing and frustrating.
Gameplay is pretty fun and interesting, the story is quite hard to follow, but by the end you'll just laugh because you spent over 10 hours playing a game that doesn't actually exist.

我曾驰骋于辽阔的海拉鲁大陆，陶醉于诗情画意的陶森特，游走于天际省的城郊，曾迷失在广阔无际的大西部，曾留恋于迷人的洛圣都，但梦醒之时最令人感到沉重以至于落泪的，只有飞升至哥伦比亚的繁华景象，销魂城前熟悉的背影，布克的自我救赎可能对全世界都是一种解脱，而对伊丽莎白却是一种残忍，或许我们永远不知道结局最后的伊丽莎白，是感到释然还是在默默流泪

Juegazo, historia, mecánicas, dificultad adecuada para cada elección de nueva partida, recomendado

Totally worth it.

One of the, if not the, best game I've ever played, and I'm not into FPS at all. 

It will do for all kind of player, ultra strategic whiwh love to plan everything of total brute that goes head down to the fight. The one that like to go straight to the end or the one that love to discover every detail left in the game (and oh boi, there's a metric ton of them). This game has it all.

Didnt enjoy this game despite being biased towards the Bioshock franshise.
You spend half of the game looking for this girl that helps you in battles and to unlock doors. This is a cheap way to keep the game going.
When in previous installments you had the government critizisim of their ways,  a decay of a society that was supposed to be elite (Rapture) which just allowed you to reflect on how are we living today.
Infinte is not at all like that, I find the time lines just not compelling and the combat system way less enjoyable than before.
I get many people might have played this first since it was  distributed to other platforms instead of just xbox. 
It shouldnt be called bioshock, you could take that part out of the title and would just be ok.
So if you liked the other bioshocks, play this at your own risk since is something different but to my taste the first games were much better made, history, combat and concept wise

Gutes Gameplay

Listen, there's a reason this game won so many awards. Yeah, I can't lie, the amount of times they remade the game during production really start to show, with various aspects of plot and design coming apart the further in you get. The interactivity of Columbia and Elizabeth, your relevance to the plot, and your emotional stakes in the story gradually become diluted the further in you go. This game has some capital-F Flaws.
And yet, it's still so much fun. The tanky, brutal gameplay is Fun! Falling in love with the neat cast of NPCs is Fun! Realising the sheer amount of potential this concept had and definitely tried to achieve is Fun! Getting into long arguments with your friends about the game's flaws and how they could've improved it is… weirdly Fun!

Buy it! Play it! Enjoy yourself! Lose yourself in the world of 2013 where Troy Baker was king and steampunk was still cool enough that people actually thought Victorian women wore their corsets on the outside of their clothes.

Just, maybe skip Burial at Sea Pt. 1. Trying to play as a built around being able to punch, shoot, and zap people hard and fast with ammunition for your guns or magic is kinda painful. Booker probably needed a bit more re-engineering for the new mechanics than he got, but it's fine; Burial at Sea Pt. 2 is a cohesive and enjoyable, story-based stealth game, just do her instead. Watch the writers scrabble to fill in all the plot holes they can think of and still manage to make the generally-enjoyable re-introduction to Rapture they really wanted Pt. 1 to be!
